result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse D Reed

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Defendant Jesse D Reed in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Jesse D Reed.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court set matter on calendar to address WCS report. 
State requests court order defendant to report to WCS to complete a drug screen. 
Atty Herbers states his client did forget to check in with WCS and just requests the court order him to report to WCS. 
Court addresses defendant and WCS report.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10-20-2022 received and filed.

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 10-20-2022: Schedule a bail hearing.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on August 5, 2022

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse D Reed
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: N47w27515 Lynndale Rd, Pewaukee, WI 53072

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:26 PM Defendant Jesse D Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
